|defaulip = 192.168.2.1 |defaultlogin = root |defaultpass = <!-- default Password, Leave blank for unknown --> |manuf = FriendlyElec |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = Armbian, DietPi, OpenWrt, Ubuntu 22.04
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = 10/2022 |estprice = 119 |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B0BN3YB9W1 |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "NanoPi R6S" and "2208" are on top and bottom of board.
{{See also|List of Single-board computers}}
===Hardware specification=== *CPU: [[Rockchip]] RK3588S @2.4GHz Quad-core ARM (Cortex-A76) :+ @1.8GHz Quad-Core ARM (Cortex-A55) *GPU: ''Mali-G610 MP4'' (OpenGL ES3.2, OpenCL 2.2); NPU Support 6T :VPU (with 8K@60fps VP9 and 8K@30fps H265/H264 decoding) *MCU: [[STMicro]] [https://www.st.com/en/microcontrollers-microprocessors/stm32g030f6.html STM32G030F6P6] @64MHz ARM (Cortex-M0+) *Storage: 32GB (eMMC 5.1) Flash, TF card (128GB)/MMC card slot *Memory: 8GB (LPDDR4X) SDRAM *Network: 2x 2.5GbE (WAN/LAN), 1x 1GbE (LAN) ports *USB: 1x USB 2.0, 1x USB 3.0 (Type-A) ports *Power Source: USB (Type-C) support PD, 5V/9V/12V/20V
==Links of Interest== *[https://wiki.friendlyelec.com/wiki/index.php/NanoPi_R6S ''NanoPi R6S'' on '''FriendlyARM''' Wiki] *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2022/10/28/nanopi-r6s-rockchip-rk3588s-router-mini-pc-dual-2-5gbe-gbe-hdmi-2-1/ ''NanoPi R6S review'' on '''CNX-Software'''] *[https://linuxgizmos.com/nanopi-r6c-taps-rockchip-rk3588s-soc/ ''NanoPi R6C taps Rockchip RK3588S SoC'' on '''LinuxGizmos''']
